SEARCH
Module test_ui1
Package test_ui.Components

Class SpyBoardController

java.lang.Object
test_ui.Components.Component.Component
test_ui.Components.SpyBoardController
public class SpyBoardController extends Component
The SpyBoardController class extends Component to manage and display a board with spy cards in a GUI application. This class handles the visualization and interactions with spy cards placed on a board. It is designed to be used in a JavaFX application, with bindings to FXML-defined UI components.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructs a new class instance to manage spy cards on a specified pane.

  • Constructor Details

    • SpyBoardController

      public SpyBoardController(javafx.scene.layout.Pane surface)
      Constructs a new class instance to manage spy cards on a specified pane.
      Parameters:
      surface - the Pane on which the spy board will be placed, allowing for visual interaction.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the controller class. This method sets up the board image and initializes the card slots with the spy card image.

    • showNextCard

      public void showNextCard()
      Shows the next spy card on the board by placing it in the next available slot. This method updates the index to point to the next slot after placing a card.

    • showCard

      public void showCard(int index)
      Shows a spy card at a specified slot index.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the slot where the card will be displayed.
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range.

    • getNextSloteRectangle

      public javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle getNextSloteRectangle()
      Returns the dimensions and position of the next available card slot as a Rectangle. This method takes into account the scaling factors provided by the Component superclass.
      Returns:
      a Rectangle that describes the next card slot's position and size.
